comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Sligo looking out towards the sea from behind Benbulben? Is this near it but from a different angle? www.flickr.com/photos/16132340@N07/2814539663/

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] I thought that initially, and don't want to steer you in the wrong direction but I think it might be in another county (from the run of Lawrence photo id numbers - though that's not always 100% accurate or scientific).
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: If it's north of the border then apart from Fermanagh I would not have a clue.  It reminds me of driving from Cavan through Leitrim to Sligo but I cannot remember the location of the spot I have in mind!

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: I say it's Glenariff. I have a similar photo. www.flickr.com/photos/13073434@N03/7655265084/in/photostream

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13073434@N03] Looks like it Robin, just shows you how much I missed by not going north more often.

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: I've a friend in Kilmacanogue just like you. Fermanagh is as far north as he's got.

comment.author: 80413507@N08
comment._content: I dont think its Glencar, the lake is missing

comment.author: 80413507@N08
comment._content: County please NLI?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13073434@N03] By George, I think you've got it! Huzzah - that's your first "Location Identified", I believe? Was fairly sure it was in Antrim, but otherwise hadn't a clue...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/80413507@N08] Antrim.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Just Googled, and here's a colourised version of our photo (from Library of Congress). Couldn't be more pleased. Another "Unidentified" bites the dust. And yet again, ye manage to surprise me - solving what I thought'd be the hard one before the easy one... :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: The LOC has that image on Flickr too:

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] It won't happen too often but it's nice to get one. I did suggest the copper mines in Avoca.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13073434@N03] Ah no, I've been a lot further north but not out in the countryside.  I rowed in regattas in Derry, Coleraine, Enniskilllen, Banbridge, Belfast etc.in the late 60's but did not have much interest in the countryside then, just winning!

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/govert1970]  Somebody has taken the trouble to colour it. I love coloured (as opposed to colour) photos.

comment.author: 13073434@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Then you are much more travelled than my friend. I love the countryside and the sea.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This beautiful photo looks like a classic U-shaped valley and truncated spurs caused by glacial erosion, if memories of school geography are correct. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U-shaped_valley

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Is anywhere in Ireland not picturesque? wow
